page.title: 01 Coastal Settlement-Otter Fe
page.content: This is a sparsely populated coastal settlement on the shores of Loch Fyne dominated by unspoilt beautiful scenery. The lower stretches are mainly pasture for grazing of sheep with some cattle, while the Hillier slopes are of semi-natural vegetation indispersed with coniferous and deciduous trees. The coastline is shingle with a sandbank stretching out across the loch. Due to the beautiful scenery and sea amenity a chalet development exists, both providing weekend amenities for people from places such as Glasgow (distance 70 miles) and as holiday chalets for tourists. A prospering fish farm (salmon) has been developed in recent years, and these two developments provide the main employment. A tea-room and craft shop are open in the summer months. The remainder of
